column1: Requirement
column4: Goal
column21: Notes

column1: CNCF Spec Functions Catalog
column4: Support for loading default functions available on the CNCF Catalog.

column1: CNCF WF Spec SDK - A2A Calls
column4: Support for A2A (Agent to Agent) calls (spec 1.1.0)

column1: CNCF WF Spec SDK - Authorization on expressions
CNCF WF Spec SDK - Dynamic  loading of resources
CNCF WF Spec SDK - MCP Support
column4: Support for MCP (Agent to Agent) calls (spec 1.1.0)

column1: CNCF WF Spec SDK - Retry on error
CNCF WF Spec SDK - Run Containers
column4: Support for running containers from a task. For example, run an isolated program on the workflow context within a container

column1: CNCF WF Spec SDK - Run Scripts
column4: Support for running custom JavaScript and Python code

column1: CNCF WF Spec SDK - Run Shell
column4: Support for running a custom isolated shell script

column1: CNCF WF Spec SDK - Scheduling
CNCF WF Spec SDK - Secrets on expression
CNCF WF Spec SDK - Timers Implementation
column4: Implement support for timers and time expressions. For example, abort workflow execution after a specified period of time

column1: Agentic Scope (Memory Context) Persistence
column4: Shared persistence mechanism between the workflow context and agentic memory. For example, users will be able to kill an HITL process and resume it later on serverless and distributed scenarios.

column1: Load Workflow YAML Descriptors from the classpath
column4: Besides the Java DSL, developers can also describe their workflows in YAML format as per the CNCF Specification. This enables LLMs to generate workflows on demand if required.

column1: OpenTelemetry Support
column4: Add traceability support for workflow invocations and lifecycle events.

column1: Spec Java SDK Persistence Integration
column4: Support the persistence layer available on the SDK for the Quarkus infrastructure.

column1: Workflow Runner API (MCP)
column4: If enabled, the Quarkus application will publish a REST Endpoint (MCP) where users can register, manage, and execute their workflows remotely. Ideal for Agentic use cases where LLMs build the workflows dynamically on supervisor/choreographic mode and execute them as a tool.

column1: Workflow Editor on DevUI
column4: Developers can use the visual editor in dev mode to modify their workflows during execution.

column1: Workflow Management Console on DevUI
column4: Manage, execute, debug, and view workflows available on the Quarkus context in DevUI mode.

column1: Implement GitOps Workflow for CEKit Manifests with Sync from kubesmarts/kie-tools to osl-images
column4: Move CEKit image manifest generation from the monorepo (kubesmarts/kie-tools) to a dedicated GitOps-compatible repository (osl-images). Automate the process using GitHub Actions (GHA) to reduce manual intervention, improve release management, and enable weekly synchronization with validations.

column1: Evaluation of OpenShift Serverless Logic Installation on "vanilla" k8s
column4: The OpenShift Serverless Logic Operator is currently certified and released exclusively for OpenShift. However, users and customers are increasingly requesting support and certification for other Kubernetes distributions, such as Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS), Minikube, KIND, and bare metal Kubernetes clusters.
column21: Evaluated and PoC Azure Kubernetes Services (AKS). Should follow IBM Cloud, AWS, Google cloud options. Evalutation of EKS and GKE on hold

We need to make sure that the addon and python interpreter are included in the product image
